item.title: 9/11 anniversary: Emotional tributes paid to lives lost
item.description: Twenty years after the deadliest attacks on US soil, those who died are remembered across the US.

item.title: Families and leaders mark 20th anniversary of 9/11
item.description: Commemorations have taken place on the 20th anniversary of the 11 September attacks.

item.title: British teenager Raducanu storms to US Open title
item.description: Emma Raducanu ends Britain's 44-year wait for a women's Grand Slam singles champion as she beats Leylah Fernandez to win the US Open.

item.title: Pope to meet Hungary's populist leader Orban
item.description: The meeting is expected to highlight differences over Mr Orban's anti-immigrant policies.

item.title: Abimael Guzmán: Peru's Shining Path guerrilla leader dies at 86
item.description: Guzmán led the Maoist rebel group which in the 1980s almost brought the Peruvian state to its knees.

item.title: Yes Sir, I Can Boogie singer dies aged 69
item.description: María Mendiola, one of the members of the duo Baccara, has died in Madrid at the age of 69.

item.title: Venice Film Festival: Abortion drama wins top prize
item.description: Audrey Diwan's Happening is set in 1960s France but comes amid debate over strict new laws in Texas.

item.title: Why are there food queues in Sri Lanka?
item.description: With a weak economy and worsening Covid-19 situation, a food emergency has been declared in the country.

item.title: Air India Express: Deadly plane crash blamed on human error
item.description: Failure to follow procedures contributed to last year's crash at Calicut airport, investigators say.

item.title: Afghanistan: US media cast doubt on Kabul drone strike
item.description: Media question both the intelligence behind the US attack on a car in Kabul and the claims of success.

item.title: Haiti PM asked to testify in President's assassination hearing
item.description: Ariel Henry has been asked why he spoke to the main suspect in the slaying of President Moise.

item.title: Four of six Palestinian prison escapees recaptured - Israel
item.description: A manhunt was launched after six inmates tunnelled out of a prison in northern Israel on Monday.

item.title: US remembers 20th anniversary of 9/11
item.description: Ceremonies are held in New York, Virginia and Pennsylvania to mark the lives lost 20 years ago.

item.title: Guantanamo Bay: In a courtroom, just feet away from 9/11 suspects
item.description: Aleem Maqbool was one of only a handful of journalists in court to see the 9/11 hearings unfold.

item.title: Keeping up with the Californians: Recall vote 2021
item.description: A ragtag bunch of 46 challengers hope voters will remove the governor and let them run California.

item.title: Nigeria's kidnap crisis: Letters replace phones
item.description: The latest tactic to tackle kidnapping gangs is to cut off mobiles and the internet.

item.title: Afghanistan: BBC catches up with Afghan journalist who fled Kabul
item.description: Wahida Faizi spoke to a reporter in August saying she feared the Taliban would kill her for her work.

item.title: 9/11 anniversary: Moment of silence as families recite names of victims
item.description: On the 20th anniversary of the 9/11 attack, New York City held a moment of silence for the lost 2,977 lives.

item.title: Red carpet debut for 'Bennifer' 2.0 in Venice
item.description: Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez arrive in Venice for the premiere of The Last Duel.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... lorry driver shortages
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at why there's a lack of drivers and how it's affecting UK businesses.

item.title: Afghanistan: Former US ambassador says leaving 'pulled the plumbing' of Afghan forces
item.description: A former US ambassador says Afghan security forces were developed to rely on US intelligence and communications.

item.title: The rare Indian swimming camels under threat
item.description: India's unique Kharai camels can swim in the sea. But their habitat is slowly disappearing.

item.title: September 11 attacks: What happened on 9/11?
item.description: How the devastating 2001 plane attacks on America unfolded and how they shaped our age.

item.title: Left without a parent after the attacks
item.description: How the terror attacks affected those whose parents died or were injured in the attacks.

item.title: September 11: The heroes of the forgotten maritime rescue mission
item.description: On 11 September, 2001, nearly 500,000 people were evacuated by boat from southern Manhattan.

item.title: 9/11 anniversary: How the world reacted to terror attacks
item.description: Two decades on, four people from around the world reflect on that day, and what's changed since.
